ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] JVM crash while running a large crawl
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi Ankur, Please see this FAQ: http://crawler.archive.org/faq.html#toomanyopenfiles Take care, i.

Hi Ankur,

Please see this FAQ:
http://crawler.archive.org/faq.html#toomanyopenfiles

Take care,
i.

> Hi,
>       I am running a large crawl with Max-Toe threads being 200.
> The crawl does fairly well for about 40-45 min before crashing
> with an following error message in the logs
> 
> INFO: GET http://home.iprimus.com.au/welling/main.html 200 4834
> text/html
> - I/O exception (java.io.FileNotFoundException) caught when processing
> request: /home/agoel/dist/run/3/scratch/tt44http.ris (Too many open
> files)
> - Retrying request
> - I/O exception (java.io.IOException) caught when processing request: 
> RIS already open for ToeThread #44: http://ja.wikipedia.org/robots.txt
> - Retrying request
> - I/O exception (java.io.IOException) caught when processing request: 
> RIS already open for ToeThread #44: http://ja.wikipedia.org/robots.txt
> - Retrying request
> - I/O exception (java.io.IOException) caught when processing request: 
> RIS already open for ToeThread #44: http://ja.wikipedia.org/robots.txt
> - Retrying request
> .
> .
> .
> #
> # An unexpected error has been detected by HotSpot Virtual Machine:
> #
> #  SIGSEGV (0xb) at pc=0xf15f27dc, pid=3054, tid=2359815072 # # 
> # Java VM: Java HotSpot(TM) Server VM (1.5.0_13-b05 mixed mode) #
> Problematic frame:
> # v  ~BufferBlob::jni_fast_GetIntField
> 
> 
> I think the problem is with unclosed/too many HttpRecorder I/O streams.
> If this is the real issue then is it a known one ?
> If not then any suggestions on why this would be happen?
> 
> Thanks
> -Ankur
> 
> 
>  
> Yahoo! Groups Links
>
